decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to combine the abilities of creatures like Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker with cards like Writhing Chrysalis and Blade of the Bloodchief to create a powerful combo. The deck also includes cards like Emrakul, the Promised End and Kozilek's Command for additional control and disruption. With support from mana-fixing lands like Eldrazi Temple and Urza's Saga, as well as utility cards like Soul-Guide Lantern and Vexing Bauble, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a strong and versatile strategy.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful creature reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance to bring back high-impact creatures such as Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. By combining instant-speed reanimation with disruptive spells like Force of Negation and Prismatic Ending, the deck aims to quickly assemble a game-winning board state while controlling the opponent's resources. The inclusion of cards like Psychic Frog and Tainted Indulgence adds additional versatility and utility to the deck, allowing for different lines of play depending on the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on aggressive creature plays while disrupting the opponent's strategy with a mix of removal and hand disruption. By combining powerful creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Solitude with disruptive spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to control the board and hit the opponent quickly. The inclusion of cards like Relic of Progenitus and Ephemerate also provide additional utility and versatility in dealing with various threats. Overall, the deck aims to pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan effectively.

The deck focuses on aggressively attacking the opponent with efficient creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Slickshot Show-Off, and Monastery Swiftspear, supported by pump spells like Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge. Mishra's Bauble synergizes with cards like Expressive Iteration and Preordain to keep card advantage while maintaining pressure. Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart provide direct damage and removal. The deck aims to control the board early and keep the pressure on the opponent to quickly finish the game. The mana base is optimized for consistent casting of spells and accessing different colors if needed.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent and reduce their life total to zero. With powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, as well as efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and finish off the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. Additionally, Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding help to protect your creatures and disrupt your opponent's game plan.

This Aggro - Affinity deck focuses on quickly playing artifacts to power up Emry, Lurker of the Loch and activate abilities from cards like Kappa Cannoneer and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. By utilizing efficient artifact spells like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal, along with strong artifacts like Urza's Saga and Thought Monitor, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast-paced and synergistic gameplay. With a mix of card advantage, disruption, and aggressive creatures, this deck aims to outpace opponents and control the board through a combination of efficient card draw and tempo plays.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures combined with disruptive elements to control the board and outpace the opponent. By using Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play, along with efficient removal spells like Fatal Push, the deck can quickly apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan. Cards like Solitude and Skyclave Apparition provide additional removal options, while Flickerwisp and Ephemerate allow for repetitive triggers and tempo plays. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient threats and disruptive elements to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively disrupt the opponent's game plan while efficiently applying pressure using a combination of powerful creatures and removal spells. By utilizing cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's strategy and creatures like Flickerwisp and Overlord of the Balemurk to apply pressure, the deck aims to control the game and secure a victory. The deck also includes cards like Ephemerate and March of Otherworldly Light to generate additional value from its creatures and spells.

The deck focuses on creating a powerful board presence by utilizing Broodscale creatures and generating value through sacrificing and reanimating them. It includes cards like Walking Ballista and Eldrazi Linebreaker to help control the battlefield. The deck also has a combo element with Emrakul, the Promised End, and Haywire Mite. Blade of the Bloodchief is used to pump up creatures and generate additional value. The deck includes mana ramp and card selection to help find key pieces quickly. Overall, the strategy revolves around assembling a strong board state and overwhelming the opponent.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting and controlling the opponent through a combination of counterspells, removal, and hand disruption. It utilizes powerful threats like Murktide Regent to close out the game while keeping the opponent's board in check with cards like Fatal Push and Spell Snare. The deck also takes advantage of graveyard interaction with cards like Unearth and Graveyard Trespasser. By efficiently answering threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan with tax effects and removal spells. It aims to pressure the opponent's life total while controlling the board with efficient removal and disruptive creatures. By combining aggressive threats with disruptive elements, the deck aims to hinder the opponent's ability to execute their game plan while advancing its own game plan of attacking and eventually winning the game through combat damage.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategies with a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. The goal is to control the game by countering key spells, removing threats, and generating value with cards like Snapcaster Mage and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck also utilizes a mix of creature threats and powerful spells to apply pressure and close out the game efficiently. By combining control elements with proactive threats, this Grixis Control deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and secure victory through calculated plays and resource management.

This deck aims to utilize powerful reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Rakshasa's Bargain to cheat in big threats like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The deck includes disruption like Force of Negation and Spell Snare to protect its combo pieces and Leyline Binding to lock down the opponent's plays. With Faithless Looting and Consign to Memory for card filtering and recursion, this deck can quickly assemble its combo and overwhelm the opponent, all while having a flexible sideboard plan with cards like Fatal Push and Teferi, Time Raveler.

This combo deck focuses on quickly assembling multiple pieces to create a powerful win condition without relying on traditional lands. By utilizing cards like Thundertrap Trainer and Lotus Bloom for mana acceleration, along with disruptive spells like Disrupting Shoal and Whir of Invention to protect the combo pieces, the deck aims to quickly set up a game-winning play with cards like Goblin Charbelcher. The deck's reliance on non-land cards for its strategy makes it a unique and fast-paced archetype in the Modern format.

The key concept of this deck is to assemble a powerful combo utilizing cards that do not require lands to function. By utilizing cards like Fallaji Archaeologist, Hydroelectric Specimen, Tameshi, Reality Architect, and Thundertrap Trainer, the deck aims to build a board state that can quickly overwhelm the opponent. Additional support comes from cards like Disrupting Shoal, Sink into Stupor, and control elements like Beyeen Veil and Jwari Disruption. The deck also includes protection spells like Spell Snare and Force of Negation to ensure the combo can go off successfully.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly damage the opponent and secure victory. It includes powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Seasoned Pyromancer, along with versatile spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment. The mana base includes a variety of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent mana fixing. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the strategy is to apply pressure and finish off the opponent quickly before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on fast and aggressive creature plays, utilizing powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to apply pressure early in the game. This strategy is supported by cards like Scion of Draco and Territorial Kavu to maintain board presence. The deck also includes a mix of control elements with cards like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial to keep opponents on the back foot. Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact provide additional support, while Tribal Flames serves as a versatile finisher. The mana base is designed to consistently support the deck's aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly playing artifacts and utilizing the affinity mechanic to overwhelm opponents with a high number of cheap threats. It includes cards that provide card advantage, mana acceleration, and removal to maintain board control. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student synergize well with the artifact theme, while Urza's Saga provides additional value by searching for powerful artifacts. The deck aims to win by efficiently deploying threats and disrupting opponents' strategies while using artifacts to gain an advantage in tempo and card advantage.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying artifacts and leveraging them to generate advantage and disrupt the opponent. By combining aggressive creatures with powerful artifacts, it aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and synergistic strategy. The deck also includes various control elements to protect its key pieces and maintain board presence. The key strength lies in the versatility of the artifacts and their ability to generate card advantage and mana advantage, allowing the deck to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent in the early game.

The deck focuses on fast, aggressive gameplay by utilizing cheap artifacts and creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Kappa Cannoneer provide early aggression, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Thought Monitor offer card advantage and value. Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal help to ramp into bigger threats, and Portable Hole provides removal. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Metallic Rebuke and Pithing Needle to control the board. Urza's Saga and Spire of Industry provide additional mana sources, allowing for explosive plays and finishing the opponent off quickly.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the Allosaurus Combo by utilizing cards like Eldritch Evolution and Neoform to tutor for key pieces like Allosaurus Rider and Disciple of Freyalise. By generating mana and creatures efficiently, the deck can ramp into big threats like Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant and Terastodon. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Pact of Negation and Consign to Memory provide protection and disruption against opposing strategies. With the ability to quickly assemble its key combo pieces, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents and secure victory before they can respond effectively.

The deck focuses on aggressive Boros creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent with damage. It includes powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, along with support cards like Guide of Souls and Goblin Bombardment. The deck also includes some control elements with cards like Static Prison and Thraben Charm to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The mana base includes a mix of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent mana fixing. Overall, the deck aims to win the game quickly through efficient creature combat and burn spells.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with strong creatures and efficient removal spells. By leveraging a combination of aggressive creatures and burn spells, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control of the board throughout the game. Additionally, the inclusion of disruptive cards like Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison adds another layer of versatility to the deck, allowing for multiple paths to victory. Overall, the deck aims to be fast-paced and punishing, looking to end the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with efficient creatures and burn spells. Utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently, supported by cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ocelot Pride. The deck also includes some disruptive elements like Static Prison and Goblin Bombardment to disrupt the opponent's strategy. With a mix of aggressive creatures and burn spells, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and close out the game before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on assembling powerful creature combos using cards such as Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker, supported by utility cards like Walking Ballista and Emrakul, the Promised End. Ramp is provided by Ignoble Hierarch and Kozilek's Command, with Ancient Stirrings and Urza's Saga helping to find key pieces quickly. The deck also aims to control the board with Malevolent Rumble and employ synergies with cards like Blade of the Bloodchief and Eldrazi Temple. Overall, the strategy revolves around overwhelming the opponent with efficient creatures and combo interactions.

The deck focuses on creating powerful combos by using cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker, Indomitable Creativity, and Leyline Binding to control the board and overwhelm the opponent. Utilizing cards like Wrenn and Six and Teferi, Time Raveler to ensure consistency and disruption. The key strategy is to curve out efficiently and disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up for explosive combos with cards like Archon of Cruelty and Pawpatch Formation. The deck thrives on a mix of creativity and resource management to outmaneuver opponents and secure victories.

The deck focuses on early game aggression while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Solitude. It also utilizes creatures with strong abilities like Flickerwisp and Psychic Frog to control the battlefield. The deck features a mix of powerful creatures and removal spells to maintain board presence and pressure the opponent. Additionally, the inclusion of Ephemerate allows for additional value by blinking key creatures. The mana base is built around fetching specific colors for the deck's spells and abilities, ensuring consistency in casting spells.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. It aims to control the board and prevent the opponent from developing their game plan. It also includes threats like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to close out the game. The deck utilizes card advantage engines like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Meticulous Archive to draw into key cards while keeping the opponent's threats in check. The mana base is built to support the control strategy with a mix of dual lands and fetch lands.

The deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emperor of Bones, then use Goryo's Vengeance or Ephemerate to bring them back into play for devastating effects. Psychic Frog and Tainted Indulgence provide deck manipulation and control options, while Solitude and Force of Negation offer protection from opponent's threats. The land base is optimized for fetching and fixing mana, with a variety of fetchlands and dual lands. The deck's ultimate goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a quick and powerful reanimation combo.

This deck utilizes aggressive creatures with disruptive abilities to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It utilizes cards like Flickerwisp and Ephemerate to temporarily remove threats, while also having access to removal spells like Fatal Push and Solitude. The deck aims to pressure the opponent while also disrupting their resources with cards like Thoughtseize and Relic of Progenitus. The mana base is focused on consistent access to all colors needed for the spells in the deck.

The main strategy of this deck is to aggressively play low cost creatures and spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It focuses on utilizing cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear to apply early pressure, while leveraging spells like Lightning Bolt and Mutagenic Growth for additional damage. The deck also includes card draw and selection spells like Expressive Iteration and Preordain to ensure consistent plays. The mana base is built around fetch lands and dual lands to provide the necessary color fixing for the deck's red-blue color identity.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build up a board presence of aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear, while using efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to control the opponent's side of the board. Mishra's Bauble helps dig for more threats and card advantage. The deck aims to apply pressure and close out the game quickly with a mix of burn spells and creature beatdown. It also includes some protection and evasion in the form of Mutagenic Growth and Slickshot Show-Off.
